title: Calories in Barbecued Chicken
meta_description: Learn calories in barbecued chicken per 100g, including protein, fat, carbs, sodium from sauce, and easy tweaks for healthier options.
assumptions: Skin-on chicken thighs, grilled with basic barbecue sauce; cooked weight, moderate charring.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, sauce type, skin inclusion, cooking time, and brand; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of barbecued chicken provides ~220 kcal, with high protein and some carbs from sauce.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in barbecued chicken per 100g?
faqs.a: Approximately 220 kcal for skin-on thighs with sauce.

faqs.q: Is barbecued chicken high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, about 25g protein per 100g, making it a lean option despite the sauce.

faqs.q: What adds the most calories to barbecued chicken?
faqs.a: Skin, sugary sauces, and added oils during grilling can increase calories significantly.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in barbecued chicken?
faqs.a: Around 400mg per 100g, mostly from the barbecue sauce.

faqs.q: Can I make barbecued chicken lower calorie?
faqs.a: Opt for skinless cuts, low-sugar sauce, or bake instead of grill to reduce fat and sugars.
